Present location: BIBLIOTHECA ALEXANDRINA ANTIQUETIES MUSEUM [01/027] ALEXANDRIA BAAM
Name: Royal Statue of Harpocrates
Description: The statue portrays Harpocrates in his royal form as a young man in the nude. He is depicted standing on a rectangular base with his left leg forward. He wears a crown and a necklace. The usual side lock of hair hangs down on the right side of his head. His right arm bends in front of the body and it possibly held a scepter.Traces of muscularity are obvious on the statue with its strong protruding chest and its shapely and firm abdomen
